intro: Ruellia lindaviana, commonly known as the Lindaviana ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Ruellia lindaviana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
